description.para: Sets the Event object to notified state, so as to wake up the waiting thread. (Only used in the top half of driver)

param_note.para: Specifies the value of the notified state. It can be any other integer without expression except zero. Default is SIGNALED.

remarks.para: Sets the Event object to notified state, so as to wake up the waiting thread. If the Event object is reset automatically, only one waiting thread will be woken up, and the Event object will be reset as not notified state. If Event object is reset manually, all the waiting thread will be woken up, and Event object will keep this notified state until calling the Event::Clear method. If no thread waits for the Event object, this method only changes the Event object into notified state.
The difference between this method and Event::NotifyByIsr is, it can only be used in the top half of a driver. (i.e. it can not be used in a interrupt service routine).
This method can not be misused with Event::NotifyByIsr.
